title: Coldplay tease new music and possible November album release
text:
Could Coldplay be about to release a new album? (Santiago Bluguermann/Getty Images)

Coldplay are teasing new music and fans are excited it could mean the beginning of a new era for the band.

The band released their last album A Head Full Of Dreams in 2015, so it wouldn’t be too surprising if we could expect a new record from the band anytime soon.

Posting a short clip of what could be a new song today, that’s what fans online are hoping.

Along with the clip, the band have posted a short video made to look like an old photograph with the date ‘November 22, 1919’ fading slowly into view on top of it.

Could this mean the band are planning to a new album on 22nd November perhaps?

Any philosophy nerds out there might also notice that the photo seems to feature the band sitting next to German philosopher Nietzsche, who died in 1900, holding a saxophone. Honestly, we’re just as confused as you are…

‘OH THAT IS BEAUTIFUL OH THIS IS SO BEAUTIFUL,’ one fan wrote in response to the band’s post.

‘JUST RELEASE THE DAMN SINGLE ALREADY,’ wrote another.

Another added: ‘finally! The 3 words half of the world population was waiting for: “COLDPLAY HAS TWEETED”’.

In 2016, Chris told Zane Lowe that there would be no more ‘conventional Coldplay albums’ after A Head Full Of Dreams, leading many to suspect that the band was announcing their retirement.

But last year they released an EP under the alias Los Unidades which featured the band’s Chris Martin, Will Berryman, Guy Champion and Jonny Buckland are masquerading under a new name.

The band are reportedly planning to release two albums over the next few months – an album of ‘experimental’ material next month and another album in 2020.

A source told The Daily Star: ‘The first album is the more experimental side of Coldplay, they probably won’t tour until 2020 when the next one arrives.’
